p: The increase of CTWD during the welding process is limited, due to the spin of the electrode resulting from the wire spooling (compare Figure 1b). Subsequently, an offset of the wire tip to the desired welding position t E may occur with increased CTWD. The consequences are unstable arc behavior, increased spattering or weld seam irregularities such as lack of fusion [ 29, 30]. In WAAM the electrode offset affects the software supported path planning with the risk of dimensional deviations from the CAD model and the work piece [ 28].
